description: The Contract is for the provision of consultant services to the contractor to fulfill the mandatory requirements set out in the Contract Letter and to maintain the satisfactory performance of the services. The consultant services are for the execution of a geotechnical and environmental program on the externe site in Inuvialuit Settlement Region for the DEW line Landfill Monitoring Program.
full_summary:
# Consultancy Services for Geotechnical and Environmental Studies
## Announcement
Defence Construction Canada is seeking proposals from qualified engineering consulting firms to provide geotechnical and environmental consultancy services for the Distant Early Warning (DEW) Line landfill monitoring program in the Inuvialuit Settlement Region of the Northwest Territories and Yukon.

### Tender Information
* **Reference Number:** PW-22-01003659
* **Publication Date:** Monday, August 8, 2022
* **Closing Date:** Tuesday, September 20, 2022 at 14:00 (Eastern Time)
* **Location:** Defence Construction Canada, Ottawa, Ontario, Canada

### Technical Background
The successful consultant will be responsible for collecting visual, chemical, spatial, thermal, and photographic data and records at the DEW Line landfill sites in the Inuvialuit Settlement Region. The estimated cost of this project is in the order of magnitude of $1,200,000.

### Selection Criteria
The proposals will be evaluated based on established criteria, which includes, but is not limited to:

* Technical qualifications and experience
* Professional associations
* Compliance with territorial rules and regulations
* Compliance with professional associations' guidelines

### Contact Information

For more information, please contact:
Keltie Leger
Phone: (343) 542-5027
Email: [keltie.leger@dcc-cdc.gc.ca](mailto:keltie.leger@dcc-cdc.gc.ca)
Address: 17th Floor, 350 Albert Street, Ottawa, ON K1A 0K3

### Responsible Office
 Defence Construction Canada, Ottawa, Ontario, Canada

### Tender Language

Proposers are required to submit their Abbreviated Proposals through the MERX Electronic Bidding System on or before the closing date indicated on the Electronic Bidding System.

The proposal evaluation process will be based on the establishment criteria. The objective is to select the proponent with the highest total score.

Please refer to the Defence Construction Canada website at [http://www.dcc-cdc.gc.ca](http://www.dcc-cdc.gc.ca) for more information.
